# UD Portuguese GSD

Language: [Portuguese](/pt/index.html) (code: `pt`)<br/>
Family: Indo-European, Romance

This treebank has been part of Universal Dependencies since the UD v1.3 release.

The following people have contributed to making this treebank part of UD: Alexandre Rademaker, Ryan McDonald, Joakim Nivre, Daniel Zeman, Fabricio Chalub, Carlos Ramisch, Juan Belieni, Vanessa Berwanger Wille, Rodrigo Pintucci.

Repository: [UD_Portuguese-GSD](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Portuguese-GSD)<br />
Search this treebank on-line: [PML-TQ](https://lindat.mff.cuni.cz/services/pmltq/#!/treebank/udpt_gsd214)<br />
Download all treebanks: [UD 2.14](/#download)

License: CC BY-SA 4.0

Genre: blog, news

Questions, comments?
General annotation questions (either Portuguese-specific or cross-linguistic) can be raised in the [main UD issue tracker](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/docs/issues).
You can report bugs in this treebank in the [treebank-specific issue tracker on Github](https://github.com/UniversalDependencies/UD_Portuguese-GSD/issues).
If you want to collaborate, please contact [arademaker&nbsp;(æt)&nbsp;gmail&nbsp;•&nbsp;com].
Development of the treebank happens directly in the UD repository, so you may submit bug fixes as pull requests against the dev branch.

| Annotation | Source |
|------------|--------|
| Lemmas | assigned by a program, not checked manually |
| UPOS | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD |
| XPOS | assigned by a program, not checked manually |
| Features | assigned by a program, not checked manually |
| Relations | annotated manually in non-UD style, automatically converted to UD |

## Description

The Brazilian Portuguese UD is converted from the [Google Universal Dependency
Treebank v2.0 (legacy)](https://github.com/ryanmcd/uni-dep-tb).

<h2>Tokenization and Word Segmentation</h2>


<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 12020 sentences, 296169 tokens and 318666 syntactic words.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 39531 tokens (13%) that are not followed by a space.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus does not contain words with spaces.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 226 types of words that contain both letters and punctuation. Examples: 's, D., &amp;, c., d', B., S., a.C., segunda-feira, J., r., sexta-feira, Sr., quinta-feira, Sul., W., quarta-feira, A., Amazon.com, Av., Don't, Yahoo!, art., dr., terça-feira, Bahá'í, E., F., I., Min., S.Paulo, UPFs/MT, a_0, a_n, d.C., dez/12, ex-ministro, ex-presidente, i.e., 'Arte, 'Fica, 'Macedão, 'n', 'o, 'y, 11/jul, 1940.http, 19h.A, 2-CH-CH2-CH3, 2/jan</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 22497 multi-word tokens. On average, one multi-word token consists of 2.00 syntactic words.</li>
<li>There are 314 types of multi-word tokens. Examples: do, da, no, na, dos, ao, das, à, pelo, pela, nos, aos, nas, às, dum, duma, pelos, num, numa, pelas, nesta, dele, desta, nalguns, deste, deles, doutros, tornou-se, neste, estende-se, dalguns, dela, dessa, noutras, trata-se, dalgumas, delas, disso, doutra, encontra-se, nalgumas, nesse, desse, doutras, noutro, donde, doutro, localiza-se, nessa, noutra.</li>
</ul>

<h2>Morphology</h2>

<h3>Tags</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 16 UPOS tags out of 17 possible: <a>ADJ</a>, <a>ADP</a>, <a>ADV</a>, <a>AUX</a>, <a>CCONJ</a>, <a>DET</a>, <a>NOUN</a>, <a>NUM</a>, <a>PART</a>, <a>PRON</a>, <a>PROPN</a>, <a>PUNCT</a>, <a>SCONJ</a>, <a>SYM</a>, <a>VERB</a>, <a>X</a></li>
<li>This corpus does not use the following tags: INTJ</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 66 word types tagged as particles (PART): ', 's, Agora, Avante, Cara, Desculpe, Nè, Ok, Olá, Oxalá, Pois, Sucesso, afro, ai, ante, anti, ar, arqui, atenção, auto, aí, bem, claro, cyber, eba, então, ex, extra, germano, greco, hein, hélio, in, infanto, infra, inter, intra, ir, latino, lá, micro, multi, on, pan, para, prático, pré, pró, pós, pô, público, recém, s, se, sub, supra, tele, to, tá, ultra, utz, vice, viu, á, ão, é</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 47 lemmas tagged as pronouns (PRON): -, _, a, algo, algum, alguém, ambos, aquele, aquilo, ela, elas, ele, eles, esse, este, eu, isso, isto, lo., mais, mesmo, muito, nada, nenhum, ninguém, nosco, nosso, noutro, nós, o, onde, outro, pouco, qual, que, quem, quão, quê, se, seu, tanto, ti, todo, tu, tudo, ue, você</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 43 lemmas tagged as determiners (DET): _, a, algum, ambos, aquele, bastante, cada, certo, cujo, dalgum, dezena, diverso, diversos, doutro, ela, eles, esse, este, mais, meu, muito, nenhum, nossa, nosso, noutro, o, outro, pouco, próprio, qual, qualquer, que, seu, tal, tanto, the, todo, um, uma, vossa, várias, vários, àquele</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 22 lemmas occurred sometimes as PRON and sometimes as DET: _, a, algum, ambos, aquele, ela, eles, esse, este, mais, muito, nenhum, nosso, noutro, o, outro, pouco, qual, que, seu, tanto, todo</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus contains 9 lemmas tagged as auxiliaries (AUX): _, dever, estar, haver, ir, poder, ser, ter, vir</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>Out of the above, 9 lemmas occurred sometimes as AUX and sometimes as VERB: _, dever, estar, haver, ir, poder, ser, ter, vir</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>There are 4 <a href="../feat/VerbForm.html">(de)verbal forms:</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Fin
  <ul>
    <li>AUX: é, foi, foram, são, está, era, será, vai, estava, estão</li>
    <li>VERB: disse, tem, acabou, chegou, começou, tornou, passou, afirmou, pode, voltou</li>
  </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Ger
  <ul>
    <li>AUX: sendo, tendo, havendo</li>
    <li>VERB: fazendo, incluindo, caindo, passando, tendo, tornando, começando, dando, falando, pensando</li>
  </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Inf
  <ul>
    <li>AUX: ser, ter, estar, serem, estarem, terem, termos</li>
    <li>VERB: ter, fazer, partir, continuar, ficar, saber, trabalhar, ver, tornar, dar</li>
  </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Part
  <ul>
    <li>AUX: sido</li>
    <li>VERB: cobertos, considerado, lançado, chamado, realizada, feito, feita, denominada, chamada, considerados</li>
  </ul>

      <li>PRON: todos, ambos, ambas, todo</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>NumType</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Card
    <ul>
      <li>DET: a, uma</li>
      <li>NUM: dois, três, mil, duas, milhões, um, 1, quatro, 2012, 2</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Mult
    <ul>
      <li>NUM: cento</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Ord
    <ul>
      <li>ADJ: primeira, primeiro, segunda, última, último, segundo, últimos, ª, primeiros, terceiro</li>
      <li>NOUN: º, segunda, primeiros</li>
      <li>PROPN: Primeira, Terceira</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>Poss</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>Yes
    <ul>
      <li>DET: seu</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>


<ul>
  <li><a>Person</a></li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>1
    <ul>
      <li>AUX-Fin: vou, vamos, Estou, estamos, tenho, Sou, Tínhamos, fomos, fui, temos</li>
      <li>AUX-Inf: termos</li>
      <li>PRON: eu, me, nós, mim, te</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: comecei, tenho, cheguei, conseguimos, fiquei, posso, Temos, acabei, acho, adoro</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf: atendermos, começarmos</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>2
    <ul>
      <li>AUX-Fin: Vá</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li>3
    <ul>
      <li>AUX-Fin: é, foi, foram, são, está, era, será, vai, estava, estão</li>
      <li>AUX-Inf: ter, serem, estarem, ser, terem</li>
      <li>PRON: se, ele, ela, eles, o, elas, lo, a, você, lhe</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin: disse, tem, acabou, chegou, começou, tornou, passou, afirmou, pode, voltou</li>
      <li>VERB-Inf: tornar, encontrar, participarem, afirmar, aparecer, aposentar, coexistirem, comer, começarem, conceder</li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>




<h3>Other Features</h3>


<ul>
  <li><a>Abbr</a>
    <ul>
      <li>Yes
        <ul>
          <li>ADJ: º</li>
          <li>NOUN: R$, nº, B., Dr, cm, dr., h, rs</li>
          <li>PROPN: S., Sr., D., B., J., N., T., W.</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>ExtPos</a>
    <ul>
      <li>ADP
        <ul>
          <li>ADP: a, em, por</li>
          <li>ADV: apesar, diante, graças, quanto</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>ADV
        <ul>
          <li>ADP: por, em, a</li>
          <li>ADV: cerca, Mesmo</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>AUX
        <ul>
          <li>VERB-Fin: chegou, passou, começou, voltou, começaram, passa, deixou, volta, voltaram, passam</li>
          <li>VERB-Ger: chegando, passando</li>
          <li>VERB-Inf: voltar, deixar, começar, passar, ter, continuar, parar, vir</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>CCONJ
        <ul>
          <li>ADP: em, A, por</li>
          <li>ADV: Além, ainda</li>
          <li>CCONJ: ou</li>
          <li>PRON: Isto</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>INTJ
        <ul>
          <li>AUX: é</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>NOUN
        <ul>
          <li>ADP: por</li>
          <li>NOUN: meio, ponto, ambiente, bota, carteira, faixa, fim, força, habeas, horário</li>
          <li>X: best, food, pet, market</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>PROPN
        <ul>
          <li>ADV: Nada</li>
          <li>DET: The, Nossa</li>
          <li>NOUN: Casa, TV, Associação, Beleza, Blue, Condado, Distrito, Igreja, Lei, Professor</li>
          <li>PRON: Que</li>
          <li>PROPN: The, São, la, O, Luiz, José, Los, Nova, United, Paulo</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
      <li>SCONJ
        <ul>
          <li>ADP: a, por, de</li>
          <li>ADV: depois, antes, apesar, ainda, além, assim, já, Mesmo, tanto</li>
          <li>SCONJ: já, assim, de, mesmo</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<ul>
  <li><a>Foreign</a>
    <ul>
      <li>Yes
        <ul>
          <li>ADJ: Cosmic, Little</li>
          <li>ADP: of</li>
          <li>ADV: More</li>
          <li>DET: The, A</li>
          <li>NOUN: Blue, Sun</li>
          <li>PROPN: All, Art, Back, Come, Con, Courtyard, For, I, Institute, It</li>
        </ul>
      </li>
    </ul>
  </li>
</ul>

<h2>Syntax</h2>

<h3>Auxiliary Verbs and Copula</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 3 lemmas as copulas (<a>cop</a>). Examples: ser, _, estar.</li>
</ul>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 9 lemmas as auxiliaries (<a>aux</a>). Examples: _, ter, ir, estar, dever, poder, haver, vir, ser.</li>
<li>This corpus uses 5 lemmas as passive auxiliaries (<a>aux:pass</a>). Examples: ser, _, estar, poder, ter.</li>
</ul>

<h3>Core Arguments, Oblique Arguments and Adjuncts</h3>

Here we consider only relations between verbs (parent) and nouns or pronouns (child).
<ul>
  <li><a>nsubj</a>
    <ul>
      <li>VERB--NOUN (5702)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-ADP(_) (1)</li>
      <li>VERB--NOUN-ADP(de) (17)</li>
      <li>VERB--PRON (3050)</li>
      <li>VERB-Fin--NOUN (739)</li>

<h3>Reflexive Verbs</h3>

<ul>
  <li>This corpus contains 227 lemmas that occur at least once with an <a>expl:pv</a> child. Examples: tornar se, encontrar se, estender se, referir se, tratar se, _ se, destacar se, localizar se, dizer se, fazer se, manter se, passar se, recusar se, situar se, ter se, ver se, dar se, desenvolver se, dever se, aplicar se, classificar se, comunicar se, esperar se, mostrar se, repetir se, saber se, sentir se, arrepender se, assemelhar se, comportar se, concentrar se, dedicar se, deparar se, espalhar se, formar se, instalar se, lembrar se, limitar se, mudar se, negar se, perder se, realizar se, recuperar se, transformar se, verificar se, abrir se, alegar se, apresentar se, apropriar se, aproveitar se</li>
</ul>



<h3>Relations Overview</h3>

<ul>
<li>This corpus uses 11 relation subtypes: <a>acl:inf</a>, <a>acl:relcl</a>, <a>aux:pass</a>, <a>csubj:pass</a>, <a>det:poss</a>, <a>expl:pv</a>, <a>flat:foreign</a>, <a>flat:name</a>, <a>nsubj:outer</a>, <a>nsubj:pass</a>, <a>obl:agent</a></li>
<li>The following 7 relation types are not used in this corpus at all: <a>vocative</a>, <a>dislocated</a>, <a>clf</a>, <a>list</a>, <a>orphan</a>, <a>goeswith</a>, <a>reparandum</a></li>
</ul>
